chunks.content_text:
08/2007 – 09/2010 HALE electronic: Software developer.
www.hale.at
2005 – 07/2007 project assistant in the Aeronautical Digital
Communications (ADC) group at the University of
Salzburg on the Institute of Computer Science.
2003 – 2004 software developer at „Gassner Wiegen und Messen“
www.gassner-waagen.com
Projects, ➢ BLU DELTA – Invoice Capturing System (Blumatix GmbH):
Conferences,
➢ An invoice entry system as a cloud and on-premise solution.
Exhibitions
➢ Developed as a microservice architecture. It is based on
ServiceStack, Azure WebApps, Azure Functions, Storage Queues,
Docker Container Services and Azure MSSQL.
➢ Creation and maintenance of various CI/CD Pipelines in Azure
DevOps.
➢ Integration of various machine learning models.
➢ Multicheck for Spark (Tecan):
➢ Architecture, design and implementation of an OQ-Tools
(operational qualification) for Spark instruments.
➢ SparkControl Software (Tecan):
➢ Design and implementation oft the control and analysis software
for the „Multimode Microplate Reader Spark 10M und Spark
20M“ in C#.
➢ UI implementation with WPF and MVVM frameworks.
➢ Database development with Entity Framework.
➢ Implementation of a communication component in C++ used for
PC-to-Instrument communication via USB
➢ TT-01 Taxameter-Terminal (Hale electronic):
➢ Architecture, design and implementation of SW-components in
C++ for an linux based embedded system
➢ Codereviews, error analysis and bug fixing
➢ UI development with GTK/GTKmm
➢ System-oriented development under Linux and the Linux Kernel.
➢ Implementation of an odometer as a Linux Kernel module.
➢ Implementation of the control software for GSM/GPS modules
(Siemens XT75)
➢ Weighting terminal DMA03 (Gassner Wiegen und Messen GmbH):
➢ Setup and commissioning of the Linux 2.4 Kernels on an ARM-
based Evaluation-Board.

Rudolf Dittrich
Freidlinger Straße 3
83317 Teisendorf
Tel. (+43 699) 19081305
E-Mail: rudi.dittrich77@gmail.com
CURRICULUM VITAE
Personal Marital status: married
Information
Nationality: Austria
Date of birth: December 8, 1977
Place of birth: Saalfelden
Education 2001-2009 Studied applied computer science in Salzburg.
Graduated with a MSc (Diplom. Ingenieur).
1998–2000 Studied chemistry in Vienna.
3 Semester Bundesrealgymnasium for working people in Salzburg
27. 01.1998 matriculation examination
7 Klassen Sport high school – HIB in Saalfelden
4 Klassen Elementary school in Maria Alm
Internships 05 – 09/2003 Internship at the University of Salzburg
Programmed a robot controller.
07 – 09/2002 ACP, Salzburg (server installation, service work on
various hardware products)
06 – 08/1999 T.E.C. THOMAS EBEL TEAM GMBH, Wien
(Sale)
Berufstätigkeit 02/2020 – until now Blumatix GmbH: AI architect
www.blumatix-consulting.at, www.bludelta.ai
11/2016 – 01/2020 Blumatix GmbH: software architect
10/2010 – 11/2016 Tecan Austria GmbH: Senior software developer and
architect.
www.tecan.com

Image Description:
[PAGE_TYPE: IMAGE-ONLY]  
[SOURCE_PAGE: 1]  

[NO_TEXT_FOUND]

08/2007 – 09/2010 HALE electronic: Software developer.
www.hale.at
2005 – 07/2007 project assistant in the Aeronautical Digital
Communications (ADC) group at the University of
Salzburg on the Institute of Computer Science.
2003 – 2004 software developer at „Gassner Wiegen und Messen“
www.gassner-waagen.com
Projects, ➢ BLU DELTA – Invoice Capturing System (Blumatix GmbH):
Conferences,
➢ An invoice entry system as a cloud and on-premise solution.
Exhibitions
➢ Developed as a microservice architecture. It is based on
ServiceStack, Azure WebApps, Azure Functions, Storage Queues,
Docker Container Services and Azure MSSQL.
➢ Creation and maintenance of various CI/CD Pipelines in Azure
DevOps.
➢ Integration of various machine learning models.
➢ Multicheck for Spark (Tecan):
➢ Architecture, design and implementation of an OQ-Tools
(operational qualification) for Spark instruments.
➢ SparkControl Software (Tecan):
➢ Design and implementation oft the control and analysis software
for the „Multimode Microplate Reader Spark 10M und Spark
20M“ in C#.
➢ UI implementation with WPF and MVVM frameworks.
➢ Database development with Entity Framework.
➢ Implementation of a communication component in C++ used for
PC-to-Instrument communication via USB
➢ TT-01 Taxameter-Terminal (Hale electronic):
➢ Architecture, design and implementation of SW-components in
C++ for an linux based embedded system
➢ Codereviews, error analysis and bug fixing
➢ UI development with GTK/GTKmm
➢ System-oriented development under Linux and the Linux Kernel.
➢ Implementation of an odometer as a Linux Kernel module.
➢ Implementation of the control software for GSM/GPS modules
(Siemens XT75)
➢ Weighting terminal DMA03 (Gassner Wiegen und Messen GmbH):
➢ Setup and commissioning of the Linux 2.4 Kernels on an ARM-
based Evaluation-Board.

08/2007 – 09/2010 HALE electronic: Software developer.
www.hale.at
2005 – 07/2007 project assistant in the Aeronautical Digital
Communications (ADC) group at the University of
Salzburg on the Institute of Computer Science.
2003 – 2004 software developer at „Gassner Wiegen und Messen“
www.gassner-waagen.com

➢ Creation and maintenance of various CI/CD Pipelines in Azure
DevOps.

➢ Architecture, design and implementation of an OQ-Tools

➢ SparkControl Software (Tecan):

➢ UI implementation with WPF and MVVM frameworks.

➢ Codereviews, error analysis and bug fixing
➢ UI development with GTK/GTKmm
➢ System-oriented development under Linux and the Linux Kernel.

➢ Weighting terminal DMA03 (Gassner Wiegen und Messen GmbH):

based Evaluation-Board.

➢ Integration of a CAN fieldbus connection using Linux CAN drivers
and CANopen.
➢ Broadband VHF „B-VHF“ (Uni Salzburg): A digital Layer-2
communication system for aviation. Implementation of a “Discrete
Event Simulator” to evaluate the B-VHF protocol.
http://www.b-vhf.org
➢ B-AMC: continuation von B-VHF
➢ Aeronautics Days 2006 (participation with poster presentation)
➢ ATC Maastrich 2006 (participation with poster presentation)
Expertise: ➢ Programming:
C#, C/C++, Python, Powershell, WPF, WinForms, WCF, Git,
VisualStudio, VS Code
➢ Container technologies: Docker, Docker-Compose, Kubernetes
➢ Cloud Development: Azure
➢ Azure Devops: CI/CD Pipelines
➢ MachineLearning, DeepLearning: Tensorflow, Keras, Scikit
➢ Databases: SQLite, MSSQL, Entity Framework 6.x
➢ Xamarin – Mobile App development (Basics)
➢ Good Linux knowledge (user- und kernel space)
➢ Software engineering concepts (Desgin Patterns, OOP, UML)
➢ Agile Software development - SCRUM
➢ Spoken and written English
➢ French (school knowledge)
Qualifications: ➢ Determined and used to working independently
➢ Curiosity, ready to learn new things
➢ Resilient, reliable, flexible and punctual
Additional training ➢ Deep Learning Specialization (Coursera, 2019)
➢ Microsoft Exam 532: Developing Microsoft Azure Solutions (exam on
27.06.2018)
➢ Self-Driving Car Nanodegree Program (Udacity, 2017)
➢ Machine Learning (Coursera, 2016)
